sub_title: Luscii | Nassau420 | Professor Digital Transformation in Healthcare | bestseller author GREEN ON | Investor | Serial Impact Entrepreneur
summary:
The future belongs to those who create it!

I started out as a carer for the elderly, and subsequently envisioned how the power of technology can transform care delivery as part of my PhD on Digital Health. Today, I am a Professor of Digital Transformation in Healthcare, an entrepreneur, a best-seller author and advisor to the Dutch government. With up to 25 million registrations in eight countries in Europe and Africa, our company Luscii is one of the fastest growing remote monitoring platforms on the market. 

Based on my experience and research, I am actively explore the three most important trends in the field of digital transformation in healthcare for the next two to three years. Digital transformation is an often quoted phrase, but how can it give patients more control and free up time for care providers? In my work I provide international examples and study results. I also reflect on how healthcare providers can organise themselves to succeed in transforming care, based on my lessons learned during an intensive private period in which he had to say goodbye to two young family members and a coincidental and unique connection with military colleagues in the Dutch Special Forces...

My values freedom, integrity and creativity guide me and strengthen my belief we should create our future ourselves!

Will you join me on my mission?

projects: [{'title': 'ParkinsonNeXt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'ParkinsonNeXt is a public private project and partnership trying to improve the self-management and selfcare of patients suffering from Parkinson Disease. A series of selfmanagement products is developed to support patients to live at home for a longer period of time with an improved quality of life and to empower patients in creating their own treatment plans together with their physicians, home carers and family. Products that are developed are a self care portal with personalized health and diagnostic data and treatment plans + advices, a medicin cabinet with feed back system and personalized apps, physical trainers with applied games and virtual reality in combination with health monitoring feed back and applied games to stimulate cognitive health, again with personalized feed back. With this set of support we aim  to create a platform where the quality of care and health impact is monitored. This can lead to a optimized treatment plan, with high impact on health treatment to be insured.  Overall, the project aims to reduce health care costs by optimizing between several health care treatments and products and avoiding hospitalization. ParkinsonNeXt  has the support of several insurance companies and is created out of the Foundation ParkinsonNet. The project is created with the financial support of GO-EFRO.  ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Daan', 'last_name': 'Dohmen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Luscii | Nassau420 | Professor Digital Transformation in Healthcare | bestseller author GREEN ON | Investor | Serial Impact Entrepreneur'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Thea', 'last_name': 'van Kemenade', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director of Health OnePlanet at Radboud University Nijmegen'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Bas Bloem, ParkinsonNet', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marten', 'last_name': 'Munneke', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Managing Director at ParkinsonNet'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Tessa van de Zande', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Laura Visser, phd, Nijmegen School of Management', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Hans van Baaren, CEO of Simultrainer', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jurriaan', 'last_name': 'van Rijswijk M Sc', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Founder at Games for Health'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Wim Smit, MRDM', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Hugo', 'last_name': 'Brand', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Directeur  Topicus Zorg'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Andre van der Veen, de Praktijkindex', 'headline': None}]}]
